A cryptographic identity system

  • Home
  • Tutorial
  • Architecture
  • Why

Identity management in distributed systems is difficult and often completely ignored. The standard is to use keypairs for identity management but those are generally locked to a particular device and have no mechanism for recovery if lost or compromised.

Stamp is an open-source protocol for personal or group identity management with a focus on ease of use in p2p or decentralized systems. It syncs your identity between your devices securely and allows publishing your identity to StampNet, a p2p network for identity discovery and verification (coming soon!).

Claims

Make claims and verify the claims of others, creating a web of trust. Some claims, such as domain or URL ownership can be verified instantly.

Keychain

Manage keys not just for general encryption or signing, but for other cryptographic applications. Stamp is like a password manager, but for keys.

Policies

Create policies for managing group identities, letting others act on your behalf, or recovering your identity in the case of a lost or compromised key.
